src.display.get_name_players(nb_players, window, butt_page_nom_player, rect_page_nom_player) → tuple[bool, list][source]

This function gets the type and the name of each player who wants to play

Parameters

  • nb_players –

  • window –

  • butt_page_nom_player –

  • rect_page_nom_player –

Return players

it’s a list of list, in which element there is the type of the player (0:human,1:ia) and if it’s an

human there is also is name (a string)

The dealer distributes one card for his self and two cards for each players and after his second card.

Select the counting_method to increase the count of the game (_counting_method = 0 : no counting) :param card: the card that has been drawn

increase_count_ko(card: Card)[source]

play_player(player: Player, i: int, windows_param: list) → int[source]

This function make a player play. To test if the split method work well change 52 by 16 in the class deck and add a condition that card.value==10 we will have the possibility to split each time

Parameters

  • windows_param –

  • i – this index allow us to know where we are in the list to pop the good element

  • player – this is the player who is about to play

Returns

the number of elements we have add to the list

a dictionary with the player’s name for key and his result and the money the owner have after this

round for value.
